main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified objects were reported in the Southwestern United States in May and June of 1952, including disc-shaped objects illuminated by very bright light and objects of varying sizes and shapes at different altitudes and distances.
interesting points: Five F-86 aircraft reported sightings of disc-shaped objects estimated to be at an altitude of approximately 25,000 feet, observed at a distance of 2-3 miles.

Numerous reports were received from airline pilots, flight crews, and others, describing objects with a variety of color characteristics, observed at distances ranging from a few miles to 25 or 30 miles, and altitudes from a few hundred feet to over 40,000 feet.
Weather conditions at the time and places of sightings were documented, including wind direction, temperature, and sky coverage.
No photographic evidence was available to account for the observed objects, and no attempt to intercept or fire upon the objects was made.
As of the report, no satisfactory explanation was known to account for the characteristics of the unidentified objects sighted.
sighted object: multiple unidentified objects of varying shapes, sizes, and color characteristics
location: Southwestern United States, including New Mexico and Oklahoma
witnesses: multiple witnesses including F-86 aircraft pilots, airline pilots, and flight crews
